page.title: 04H.M.S.COLLINGWOOD
page.content: H.M.S. COLLINGWOOD WAS BUILT IN 1919 ON FAREHAM MARSH AS A NEW ENTRY TRAINING ESTABLISHMENT. IT SOON BECAME RESPONSIBLE FOR TRAINING ELECTRICAL AND RADIO SPECIALISTS BUT IS N0W THE ROYAL NAVY'S WEAPONS ENGINEERING SCHOOL. IT COVERS 197 ACRES MAKING IT THE LARGEST TRRAINING ESTABLISHMENT IN THE NAVY. THERE ARE 2,800 STAFF AND TRAINEES SERVING AT ANY ONE TIME PLUS AN ADDITIONAL 400 CIVILIANS IN ANCILLARY AND SUPPORTINNG POSTS. 8,000 MEN ARE TRAINED ANNUALLY AND COURSES RANGE FROM FOUR YEAR APPRENTICESHIPS (TO B TECH SPECIFICATION) TO 24 HOURS OF PREJOINING TRAINING. THIS INCLUDES MEN FROM 17 FOREIGN NAVIES. A MULTI MILLION POUND IMPROVEMENT SCHEME IS CURRENTLY UNDERWAY AND WILL BE COMPLETED IN THE 1990S.
